   1 """
   2 This is Victor Stinner's pure-Python implementation of PEP 383: the "surrogateescape" error
   3 handler of Python 3.
   4 Source: misc/python/surrogateescape.py in https://bitbucket.org/haypo/misc
   5 """
   6 
   7 # This code is released under the Python license and the BSD 2-clause license
   8 
   9 import codecs
  10 import sys
  11 
  12 import six
  13 
  14 FS_ERRORS = "surrogateescape"
  15 
  16 #     # -- Python 2/3 compatibility -------------------------------------
  17 #     FS_ERRORS = 'my_surrogateescape'
  18 
  19 
  20 def u(text):
  21     if six.PY3:
  22         return text
  23     else:
  24         return text.decode("unicode_escape")
  25 
  26 
  27 def b(data):
  28     if six.PY3:
  29         return data.encode("latin1")
  30     else:
  31         return data
  32 
  33 
  34 if six.PY3:
  35     _unichr = chr
  36     bytes_chr = lambda code: bytes((code,))
  37 else:
  38     _unichr = unichr  # type: ignore
  39     bytes_chr = chr
  40 
  41 
  42 def surrogateescape_handler(exc):
  43     """
  44     Pure Python implementation of the PEP 383: the "surrogateescape" error
  45     handler of Python 3. Undecodable bytes will be replaced by a Unicode
  46     character U+DCxx on decoding, and these are translated into the
  47     original bytes on encoding.
  48     """
  49     mystring = exc.object[exc.start : exc.end]
  50 
  51     try:
  52         if isinstance(exc, UnicodeDecodeError):
  53             # mystring is a byte-string in this case
  54             decoded = replace_surrogate_decode(mystring)
  55         elif isinstance(exc, UnicodeEncodeError):
  56             # In the case of u'\udcc3'.encode('ascii',
  57             # 'this_surrogateescape_handler'), both Python 2.x and 3.x raise an
  58             # exception anyway after this function is called, even though I think
  59             # it's doing what it should. It seems that the strict encoder is called
  60             # to encode the unicode string that this function returns ...
  61             decoded = replace_surrogate_encode(mystring)
  62         else:
  63             raise exc
  64     except NotASurrogateError:
  65         raise exc
  66     return (decoded, exc.end)
  67 
  68 
  69 class NotASurrogateError(Exception):
  70     pass
  71 
  72 
  73 def replace_surrogate_encode(mystring):
  74     """
  75     Returns a (unicode) string, not the more logical bytes, because the codecs
  76     register_error functionality expects this.
  77     """
  78     decoded = []
  79     for ch in mystring:
  80         # if utils.PY3:
  81         #     code = ch
  82         # else:
  83         code = ord(ch)
  84 
  85         # The following magic comes from Py3.3's Python/codecs.c file:
  86         if not 0xD800 <= code <= 0xDCFF:
  87             # Not a surrogate. Fail with the original exception.
  88             raise NotASurrogateError
  89         # mybytes = [0xe0 | (code >> 12),
  90         #            0x80 | ((code >> 6) & 0x3f),
  91         #            0x80 | (code & 0x3f)]
  92         # Is this a good idea?
  93         if 0xDC00 <= code <= 0xDC7F:
  94             decoded.append(_unichr(code - 0xDC00))
  95         elif code <= 0xDCFF:
  96             decoded.append(_unichr(code - 0xDC00))
  97         else:
  98             raise NotASurrogateError
  99     return str().join(decoded)
 100 
 101 
 102 def replace_surrogate_decode(mybytes):
 103     """
 104     Returns a (unicode) string
 105     """
 106     decoded = []
 107     for ch in mybytes:
 108         # We may be parsing newbytes (in which case ch is an int) or a native
 109         # str on Py2
 110         if isinstance(ch, int):
 111             code = ch
 112         else:
 113             code = ord(ch)
 114         if 0x80 <= code <= 0xFF:
 115             decoded.append(_unichr(0xDC00 + code))
 116         elif code <= 0x7F:
 117             decoded.append(_unichr(code))
 118         else:
 119             # # It may be a bad byte
 120             # # Try swallowing it.
 121             # continue
 122             # print("RAISE!")
 123             raise NotASurrogateError
 124     return str().join(decoded)
 125 
 126 
 127 def encodefilename(fn):
 128     if FS_ENCODING == "ascii":
 129         # ASCII encoder of Python 2 expects that the error handler returns a
 130         # Unicode string encodable to ASCII, whereas our surrogateescape error
 131         # handler has to return bytes in 0x80-0xFF range.
 132         encoded = []
 133         for index, ch in enumerate(fn):
 134             code = ord(ch)
 135             if code < 128:
 136                 ch = bytes_chr(code)
 137             elif 0xDC80 <= code <= 0xDCFF:
 138                 ch = bytes_chr(code - 0xDC00)
 139             else:
 140                 raise UnicodeEncodeError(
 141                     FS_ENCODING, fn, index, index + 1, "ordinal not in range(128)"
 142                 )
 143             encoded.append(ch)
 144         return bytes().join(encoded)
 145     elif FS_ENCODING == "utf-8":
 146         # UTF-8 encoder of Python 2 encodes surrogates, so U+DC80-U+DCFF
 147         # doesn't go through our error handler
 148         encoded = []
 149         for index, ch in enumerate(fn):
 150             code = ord(ch)
 151             if 0xD800 <= code <= 0xDFFF:
 152                 if 0xDC80 <= code <= 0xDCFF:
 153                     ch = bytes_chr(code - 0xDC00)
 154                     encoded.append(ch)
 155                 else:
 156                     raise UnicodeEncodeError(
 157                         FS_ENCODING, fn, index, index + 1, "surrogates not allowed"
 158                     )
 159             else:
 160                 ch_utf8 = ch.encode("utf-8")
 161                 encoded.append(ch_utf8)
 162         return bytes().join(encoded)
 163     else:
 164         return fn.encode(FS_ENCODING, FS_ERRORS)
 165 
 166 
 167 def decodefilename(fn):
 168     return fn.decode(FS_ENCODING, FS_ERRORS)
 169 
 170 
 171 FS_ENCODING = "ascii"
 172 fn = b("[abc\xff]")
 173 encoded = u("[abc\udcff]")
 174 # FS_ENCODING = 'cp932'; fn = b('[abc\x81\x00]'); encoded = u('[abc\udc81\x00]')
 175 # FS_ENCODING = 'UTF-8'; fn = b('[abc\xff]'); encoded = u('[abc\udcff]')
 176 
 177 
 178 # normalize the filesystem encoding name.
 179 # For example, we expect "utf-8", not "UTF8".
 180 FS_ENCODING = codecs.lookup(FS_ENCODING).name
 181 
 182 
 183 def register_surrogateescape():
 184     """
 185     Registers the surrogateescape error handler on Python 2 (only)
 186     """
 187     if six.PY3:
 188         return
 189     try:
 190         codecs.lookup_error(FS_ERRORS)
 191     except LookupError:
 192         codecs.register_error(FS_ERRORS, surrogateescape_handler)
 193 
 194 
 195 if __name__ == "__main__":
 196     pass
